title: Where to invest Rs 1 lakh - gold, silver, stocks, mutual funds? Experts decode right mix
content: While experts believe that one investment strategy doesn’t work for everyone, and risk profile and time horizon play a crucial role, they are broadly in consensus on what a large part of your portfolio should look like.

title: 'Can’t let craziest regime to have nuclear weapons': JD Vance ahead of US-Iran talks in Geneva
content: US Vice President JD Vance stated that the Trump administration is committed to preventing Iran, described as the world's "craziest and worst regime," from obtaining nuclear weapons. While prioritizing diplomacy, Vance emphasized that President Trump possesses other tools to achieve this goal, urging Iran to take negotiations seriously.

title: India & Israel will build iron alliance against threat of extremist Islam: Netanyahu
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu announced an "iron alliance" with India against extremist Islam, emphasizing shared values of moderation and human dignity. He lauded the "miraculous" bilateral relationship, highlighting doubled trade and tripled cooperation. Netanyahu expressed deep gratitude for India's support following the October 7th attack, calling Israel's campaign a "defensive war for the truth."

title: 4 passengers of US speedboat shot dead by Cuban coast guard
content: Cuba's coastguard shot dead four people and injured six others travelling in a US-registered speedboat in an exchange of fire off the Cuban coast on Wednesday, the interior ministry in Havana said. As a coastguard vessel approached to identify the boat "shots were fired from the boat," injuring the commander of the Cuban vessel, the ministry added.

title: Samsung Galaxy S26 Ultra launched: Price, specifications and all details
content: Samsung has unveiled its latest flagship, the Galaxy S26 Ultra, featuring a groundbreaking Privacy Display for enhanced data protection. This new device boasts a powerful Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5 chip, an impressive 200MP camera system, and a 5,000mAh battery with 60W fast charging. Pre-orders are now open, with the phone available in several striking colours.

title: 'We feel your pain': PM Modi condemns 'barbaric' Hamas attack in historic Knesset speech
content: ​Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived at the Knesset, where Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his wife Sara Netanyahu attended an official reception ceremony on Wednesday. With 'Modi, Modi' chants, PM Narendra Modi receives a standing ovation at the Knesset, Israeli parliament, upon his arrival. PM Modi extended condolences over the "barbaric terrorist attack Hamas carried out on October 7, 2023.

title: Day 2 of DefSAT conference witnesses 6 MoUs exchanges among space companies
content: Defence experts at DefSat2026 stressed India's need for a robust space capability amidst global military space infrastructure growth. Discussions highlighted that persistent space power is now vital for national security, not just an ambition. The conference also saw significant B2B collaborations, with six MoUs signed, underscoring private sector confidence in India's defence space sector.

title: HP feels pressure as company says RAM prices are nearly one-third of total PC cost
content: HP Inc. is experiencing a significant surge in PC material costs, with RAM now accounting for 35% of the bill of materials, up from 15-18% last quarter. This rise is expected to impact Personal Systems Operating Profit margins, though HP is implementing cost-saving measures and strategic inventory management to mitigate the effects.

title: Santner, Rachin Ravindra dismantle Sri Lanka, keep NZ in the hunt for semis
content: Mitchell Santner and Cole McConchie stitched together a crucial seventh-wicket stand of 84 to lift New Zealand from 84 for 6 to 168/7. Matt Henry led the bowling with two wickets, including a maiden over, while Rachin Ravindra’s 4 for 27 restricted Sri Lanka to 107/8, handing New Zealand a 61-run win.

title: Joe Burrow spends $1 million as Olivia Ponton takes fresh life reset
content: Joe Burrow and popular model, Olivia Ponton, have been rumroed to be in a relationship with each other since the end of 2024. As the Bengals' star player Joe Burrow recovers from a pretty brutal season on the field, it seems his rumored girlfriend Olivia Ponton has taken a break in her life as she posted about taking a reset.

title: Google says sorry for BAFTA news alert; that said: See more on …
content: Google has issued a formal apology after a news notification containing a racial slur was sent to users. The alert was related to an involuntary outburst of the N-word by an audience member with Tourette syndrome during the BAFTAs. Google stated the error was a system malfunction, not AI-generated, and has since removed the offensive notification.

title: Quote of the day by Keanu Reeves: ‘If you're a lover, you've gotta be a fighter’
content: "If you're a lover, you've gotta be a fighter"... Keanu Reeves said this famous quote on 'The Drew Barrymore Show' in 2021. In Keanu’s philosophy, "fighting" isn't about physical aggression, but rather the effort, commitment, and resilience required to maintain and protect a deep bond.

title: J&K captain brushes aside head-butt incident in Ranji final as 'heat of the moment'
content: Jammu and Kashmir captain Paras Dogra downplayed an on-field head-butting incident during the Ranji Trophy final, calling it a momentary heat-of-the-moment exchange.  Focusing on his team's strong position at 527/6, Dogra emphasized their strategy to bat long for a first-innings lead, aiming to secure a result against Karnataka.

title: Candace Owens sparks backlash with “Bride of Charlie” series on Erika Kirk
content: Candace Owens has stirred major controversy after releasing the trailer for her YouTube investigative series The Bride of Charlie, centered on Erika Kirk. The preview quickly went viral, prompting backlash, intense online debate, and questions directed at Charlie Kirk’s allies. While supporters call it accountability journalism, critics warn it risks harassment and speculation, as silence from prominent conservative voices fuels growing tension.

title: Josh Allen & Hailee Steinfeld 2026 combined net worth and earnings breakdown
content: Buffalo Bills quarterback Josh Allen and actress Hailee Steinfeld are a prominent couple who got married in 2025 and expecting their first child. Their combined net worth is estimated at $125 million in 2026, with Allen's NFL contracts and endorsements forming the bulk of their wealth, complemented by Steinfeld's successful entertainment career.

title: Winner of Beast Games Season 2: Tyler Lucas Wins $5.1M Prize
content: Tyler Lucas won Beast Games Season 2 on February 24, 2026, taking home $5.1 million after choosing the correct suitcase in the finale. The season awarded more than $11 million overall to the top contestants. Lucas, a former Air Force pilot and Penn State player, confirmed his win on X, while MrBeast highlighted the record-breaking payouts.

title: Dubai Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan’s emotional birthday tribute to son Mohammed
content: Dubai's Crown Prince, Fazza, captivated millions with a touching video montage celebrating his son Mohammed's third birthday. The heartwarming compilation, shared on Instagram, beautifully chronicled the young prince's journey from infancy to toddlerhood, featuring intimate family moments. This deeply personal tribute resonated globally, highlighting universal themes of family, time and parental pride.

title: Flying through Dubai airport? Know viral 15-phone rule before you pack
content: Dubai International Airport (DXB) allows passengers to carry up to a limited number of portable electronic devices, including phones and laptops, per person. This regulation, driven by lithium battery safety concerns, requires devices to be switched off and properly packed. Travellers should protect spare batteries and consider carrying essential electronics in carry-on baggage for a smoother security experience.

title: Oil market price battle: Russia & Iran offer heavy discounts to China as crude piles up at sea
content: Russian and Iranian oil producers are offering deeper discounts to Chinese buyers as India reduces its purchases.  Analysts note China's independent refiners are nearing capacity, leading to unsold oil piling up.  This situation impacts Russia's war funding and Iran's export efforts amid geopolitical tensions.

title: 'Speaker of the Knesset Medal': PM Modi conferred with Israel's highest parliamentary honour
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received the prestigious "Speaker of the Knesset Medal," Israel's highest parliamentary honour, for bolstering strategic ties. He is the first Indian PM to be so recognized. This visit also saw him address the Israeli parliament for the first time, emphasizing friendship and partnership with the nation.

title: Horoscope today: Daily astrological predictions for all zodiac signs
content: Horoscope Today: Read daily horoscope predictions for February 26, 2026. Know all about the astrological events and influences that will be affecting each of the 12 zodiac signs. Our astrologer has analyzed the movements of the planets and the alignment of the stars to bring you the most accurate and up-to-date horoscope predictions for the day ahead. Get ready to discover what the stars have in store for you today.

title: 'Pressure does funny things': Giant-killer Zimbabwe warn wounded India
content: Zimbabwe's Ryan Burl believes the pressure of a must-win T20 World Cup match against India could affect the hosts. He highlighted Zimbabwe's diverse bowling attack as a potential advantage against India's strong batting lineup. Burl also confirmed captain Sikandar Raza is fit to play.

title: Trumponomics: Over a year into 2nd term, Donald’s economic policy shows mixed results
content: US President Donald Trump's second term sees a mixed economic picture: strong growth and tech investment clash with stalled job gains and inflation worries.  Supreme Court's tariff ruling adds uncertainty. While manufacturing output rises, factory jobs decline.  Affordability remains a concern for households despite overall economic momentum.

title: Delhi quadruple murder: Pregnant woman, three daughters found with throats slit; husband missing
content: A pregnant woman and her three young daughters were found murdered with their throats slit in their Delhi home. Police are searching for the woman's husband, a vegetable seller, who is the prime suspect and has been missing since the morning. The motive is under investigation, with potential angles including preference for a male child.

title: Nasa's ambitious Moon mission delayed: Artemis II rocket rolled back for repairs
content: NASA has rolled back its Artemis II moon rocket and Orion spacecraft from the launch pad to the Vehicle Assembly Building due to a new technical issue with the helium pressurisation system. This setback, following earlier hydrogen leaks, means the planned March launch window is now unattainable.

title: Indian man deported from Singapore in alleged job visa scam
content: A Bhayandar man was deported from Singapore after his work visa and job offer were found to be fake, costing him INR 3.6 lakh. Immigration authorities discovered the company didn't exist and the visa was forged. Police are investigating the suspected job scam. Experts urge job seekers to verify employers and visa procedures independently to avoid such fraudulent schemes.

title: R Madhavan says fans flew from Dubai to India to watch Dhurandhar
content: R Madhavan believes 'Dhurandhar' has marked a turning point, moving away from traditional war narratives. Despite a ban in the UAE, fans demonstrated extraordinary dedication, flying in to watch the film, highlighting the power of compelling content and the communal cinema experience. The sequel is set for a major box office clash during the Eid weekend.

title: Red Fort blast case: NIA arrests two more terror suspects, 11 apprehended in total
content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has arrested two more individuals, Zameer Ahmad Ahangar and Tufail Ahmad Bhat, in connection with last year's Red Fort area blast. These arrests bring the total to 11, with the duo allegedly supplying weapons to the prime accused. Investigations reveal they were active overground workers for the Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind terror outfit.

title: 'It's saffron!' PM Modi reacts to colour of Sara Netanyahu's outfit - watch
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a warm welcome in Tel Aviv, with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu noting the matching saffron colors of Modi's pocket square and his wife's outfit. Modi's visit, the first by an Indian PM to the Knesset, aims to strengthen the "robust and multifaceted Strategic Partnership" between India and Israel.

title: AI disruption: At $380bn, Anthropic valuation more than combined market cap of top Indian IT stocks
content: The swift advancement of artificial intelligence - particularly Anthropic’s recent innovations - has unsettled Indian technology stocks. The impact has been sharp, with the Nifty IT index dropping about 21% in February.

title: Cigarettes after tax: Smokers left fuming, tobacco black market lights up
content: India's recent steep cigarette tax hike has triggered immediate chaos, with prices soaring and supplies dwindling. Retailers are struggling, and consumers face inflated costs. This mirrors global trends where high taxes, without robust enforcement, fuel illicit trade and organized crime, potentially undermining public health goals and government revenue.

title: 'It was just too much': Manjrekar tears into Gautam Gambhir's tactics
content: Sanjay Manjrekar criticized Gautam Gambhir's tactics after India's heavy T20 World Cup loss to South Africa. He questioned promoting Washington Sundar to number five, calling him an 'all-in-one' solution for batting and bowling issues. Manjrekar also highlighted the team's struggle with slower balls, urging focus on this area before their crucial match against Zimbabwe.

title: 'Galti se ho gaya': Son's flippant reply on why he shot father, chopped up body — watch
content: A chilling video has surfaced showing a 21-year-old Lucknow man calmly claiming “Galti se ho gaya” (“It happened by mistake”) after allegedly shooting and dismembering his father following a heated argument over exam pressure. The accused from the chilling Lucknow murder case, Akshat, is seen offering the brief remark when questioned about the gruesome crime.

title: The Ayyappa awaits: Sabarimala supreme's sanctum nears Supreme Court's final verdict
content: ​In 2006, the Indian Young Lawyers Association approached the Supreme Court of India, arguing that barring women violated constitutional guarantees of equality and freedom of religion. By 2016, the Court began openly questioning whether such a ban could withstand constitutional scrutiny. In September 2018, a five-judge Constitution Bench delivered a 4 to 1 verdict that shook Kerala.

title: Can Pakistan still qualify for T20 World Cup semifinal after loss to England?
content: England secured a T20 World Cup 2026 semi-final spot after a thrilling victory over Pakistan. Captain Harry Brook's maiden T20I century was the highlight, guiding England home in a tense chase. Pakistan's qualification now hinges on other results, facing a challenging path to the last four.

title: CBSE withdraws Noida school affiliation after HC probe — what it means for students
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education has withdrawn the affiliation of a Noida-based school after an inquiry confirmed complaints of mental harassment, forced salary deductions and administrative irregularities. Acting on directions from the Allahabad High Court, CBSE found serious violations of its Affiliation Bye-Laws and workplace safety norms. While Class X and XII students can complete the current session, those in Classes IX and XI will be shifted to nearby schools for the next academic year.

title: 'Attack will bring strong response': Iran pushes back against Trump a day before Geneva talks
content: Iran has strongly refuted US President Trump's accusations of rebuilding nuclear and missile capabilities, calling them "big lies." Ahead of crucial talks in Geneva, Iranian officials stated that "honourable diplomacy" could lead to success, but warned against confrontation. Tehran insists its dignity and mutual interests must be respected during negotiations.

title: Motorists complain of bumpy ride on newly built flyover
content: They say Madhya Kailash flyover does not offer a smooth ride; highway officials point out that the surface was kept rough to prevent speeding

title: Two-child norm for panchayat, local body elections scrapped in Rajasthan after three decades
content: Congress strongly criticises the State Cabinet’s decision; the BJP on the one hand advises a particular community to control population growth, and was repealing the two-child norm on the other, Govind Singh Dotasra says

title: NCERT apologises, says distribution of book with section on ‘corruption’ in judiciary stopped
content: After the Supreme court registers suo motu case over the matter, the NCERT apologises for the ‘inappropriate textual material’ and ‘error in judgement’ that had ‘inadvertently crept’ into the chapter.

title: Political criticism that ruling party may even ‘give a wife to everyone’ is not misogynistic: Madras High Court
content: Justice A.D. Jagadish Chandira quashes proceedings initiated by Tamil Nadu Commission for Women against AIADMK MP C.Ve. Shanmugam for making such a statement

title: CBI arrests three in ‘digital arrest’ fraud case after searches in six States
content: ‘Through meticulous digital forensics and financial trail analysis, investigators uncovered a complex network spanning multiple States, with indications of international linkages,’ the CBI says

title: Cash row: Lok Sabha Speaker reconstitutes panel probing charges against Justice Yashwant Varma
content: The Speaker had constituted the committee on August 12 last year after admitting a multi-party notice for the removal of the Allahabad High Court judge, setting in motion the process of his impeachment.

title: Karnataka High Court lays down procedure to access spouse’s income-tax returns in matrimonial disputes
content: The Karnataka High Court has issued comprehensive guidelines for spouses to obtain income tax returns and financial records of their partners in maintenance proceedings, as the law does not permit couples in matrimonial disputes to access each other’s financial data under the Right to Information Act

title: Rahul targets Modi over trip to Israel and trade deal with U.S., brings up ‘Epstein Files’
content: Mr. Gandhi questions PM’s trip amid Indo-U.S. trade deal row while Congress leader Pawan Khera cites ‘Epstein Files’ emails, alleging foundation of India-Israel ties was laid by late American financier and child sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Food Safety officers launch State-wide milk safety inspections after deaths
content: Samples of milk and other dairy products are being collected from vendors to check if there is any urea or starch adulteration, says State IPM Director

title: Real-estate promoter shot dead in Howrah, journalist assaulted after questioning Trinamool MLA over links to the crime
content: Videos of the accused in the murder riding pillion on local Trinamool Congress MLA Gautam Chowdhury’s motorbike surfaced on social media

title: Officials to keep track of census data collection real time
content: Around 32 lakh field functionaries will be deployed for census operations; satellite imagery will be used for clear identification of habitations and settlements

title: NIA arrests two more accused in Delhi car bomb blast case
content: The federal agency says the two are over ground workers of the Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind (AGH) terror outfit and allegedly supplied weapons to the prime accused in the case, Umar Un Nabi, who was also killed in the explosion

title: Amit Shah on three-day visit to Bihar’s Seemanchal
content: In three-day visit, the Home Minister will participate in various initiatives, including the inauguration of border outposts, and the e-inauguration and foundation laying of several works of the Sashastra Seema Bal

title: SRMIST, The Hindu to organise panel discussion series on future careers
content: The series is aimed at benefiting undergraduate aspirants, postgraduate candidates, and working professionals in various fields such as humanities and sciences, entrepreneurship, law, public health, pharmacology, allied health sciences and nursing, medical and dental sciences, occupational therapy and physiotherapy, engineering, and agriculture.

title: 629 cow smuggling cases registered in Gujarat in two years
content: Minister of State for Law and Justice Kaushik Vekariya said 50 people were externed and 39 properties linked to the accused, collectively valued at around ₹6 crore, were demolished

title: Cases stall as judicial officers busy with SIR in West Bengal
content: Former Rajya Sabha MP Jawhar Sircar, who had served as Chief Electoral Officer of West Bengal, said that involving judicial officers in SIR appeared to be a ‘knee-jerk reaction’

title: No change in SIM-binding directions to platforms: Scindia
content: The November 2025 order, due for compliance this month, will not be extended, says Communications Minister. He says ‘national security’ and ‘fraud’ were considered in issuing this order, which WhatsApp parent Meta has pushed back on through industry associations.

title: ‘Shirtless’ protest: Three more Congress workers held in Shimla
content: Saurabh, Siddharth and Arbaz apprehended by Special Cell of Delhi Police from a hotel in Shimla district; arrests led to a dramatic turn of events after Himachal Police intercepted the Delhi Police team while they were transporting the accused to Delhi

title: Bill meant to replace UGC, AICTE circulated among 39 Ministries, departments for discussions, says government
content: 31-member JPC, which was set up to examine Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhishthan Bill, will hold its first meeting today Bill

title: Centre rejects RTI seeking details of pre-legislative consultations on VB-G RAM G Act
content: In its response, the Rural Development Ministry said the information could not be shared because the scheme ‘has not yet been formally notified by the States/UTs and has not become operational in any State/U.T.’

title: ‘Loose connection’ prevented NVS-02 satellite from landing in intended orbit, says panel
content: The committee, which probed the failure, says the signal meant to activate a key valve in the engine’s oxidiser line never reached it; this valve is crucial for firing the engine to raise the spacecraft’s orbit

title: PM Modi conferred with Israel’s ‘Speaker of the Knesset Medal’
content: The medal was conferred in recognition of the Prime Minister’s exceptional contribution — through his personal leadership — to strengthen strategic relations between India and Israel

title: Palaniswami hits back at Stalin, calls the DMK a ‘slave’ of the Congress
content: ‘We have never been slaves of anyone. We believe in our constructive work. By implementing [welfare] projects, we had secured the support [of the Centre]. But your party is not like us. The Congress had secured seats by intimidating the DMK,’ the AIADMK leader says at a meeting at Vanagaram near Chennai

title: Ahead of Assembly election, DMK women’s  grassroots push blends politics with AR outreach
content: ‘Vellum Tamil Pengal’ campaign deploys booth-level women cadres armed with booklets, QR codes and augmented reality to deepen voter connect — while opening new space for women in party politics.

title: Class 10 Student Delivers Baby During Board Exam In Madhya Pradesh
content: In a shocking incident reported from Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district, a minor girl studying in Class 10 delivered a baby boy during her board examination at an exam centre in Pithampur, a police officer said.

title: Admit Card With Pass Certificate Can Be Accepted: Top Court On Bengal SIR
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday directed electoral authorities in West Bengal to ensure the submission of pending verification documents by 5 pm on February 26 to judicial officers overseeing the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of electoral rolls.

title: Speaker Om Birla Re-Constitutes Panel To Probe Judge In Cash Row
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has re-constituted a three-member committee to investigate the corruption allegations against Justice Yashwant Varma, the judge of the Allahabad High Court, at whose home piles of burnt cash was found.

title: Armed Robbers Loot Jewellery Worth Rs 60 Lakh In Delhi's Chandni Chowk
content: Three armed assailants looted gold jewellery worth approximately Rs 60 lakh from a shop in the Kinari Bazar area of Chandni Chowk in Delhi on Wednesday.

title: Rajasthan Cabinet Removes 2-Child Norm For Local Body Polls After 3 Decades
content: In a significant policy shift, the Rajasthan Cabinet on Wednesday approved the removal of the decades-old two-child norm for contesting Panchayati Raj and urban local body elections, ending a restriction that had been in place for nearly 30 years.

title: "It Was A Mistake": Lucknow Man Who Murdered Father, Chopped His Body
content: "It happened by mistake," the 21-year-old, accused of killing his father and dismembering the body, said on Wednesday while being taken to a local court amid tight security.

title: No Cockpit Voice, Flight Data Recorder In Plane That Crashed In Jharkhand
content: The nearly 40-year-old Beechcraft C90A aircraft that crashed in Jharkhand on Monday, killing seven people, did not have cockpit voice or flight data recorders, according to the aviation regulator DGCA.

title: "Modi Hug Is Special": Netanyahu's High Praise For "Brother" PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's trademark "hugplomacy", where he embraces world leaders in his trademark hug, has once again drawn international attention after Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu praised what he called the famous "Modi hug".

title: Over 5,000 Tribals Join BJP In Assam's Goalpara, Weeks Before Elections
content: A massive joining programme was organised by the BJP ST Morcha, Assam Pradesh, at the Agia School playground in Goalpara district on February 25.

title: Anti-Terror Agency NIA Arrests 2 More In Red Fort Blast Case
content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) has apprehended two more terror operatives allegedly involved in the Delhi Red Fort area bomb blast conspiracy, taking the total number of arrests in the case to 11.

title: Drama Follows Youth Congress Workers' Arrest, Cops File Case Against Cops
content: A confrontation between two state police forces unfolded on a highway in Himachal Pradesh on Saturday, escalating into a rare situation in which one police unit registered a criminal case against officers from another state.

title: 'Kerala' In Use From 2nd-Century BC: Shashi Tharoor's History Lesson On Name Change
content: The renaming of "Kerala" to "Keralam" is not just a "trivial" issue to focus on when key issues are going unattended, it also jettison's a name with far more antiquity, senior Congress leader and Thiruvananthapuram MP Shashi Tharoor has told NDTV.

title: "Windpipes Were Cut": Delhi Man Slits Throats Of Pregnant Wife, 3 Daughters
content: A man allegedly slit the throats of his two-month pregnant wife and three daughters at their residence in the outer north area of the national capital, with police suspecting that his preference for a son could be behind the killings.

title: Cuts On Lips, Eye: 2-Year-Old Girl Mauled By Stray Dog In Maharashtra
content: A two-year-old girl sustained severe injuries, including deep cuts on her lips, cheeks, and eye, after she was attacked by a stray dog in Maharashtra's Ahilyanagar on Wednesday.

title: In Mumbai Civic Body's Rs 81,000-Crore Budget, Big Infra, Education Push
content: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has presented a massive Rs 80,952.56 crore budget for the 2026-27 fiscal year, marking an 8.77 per cent increase over last year's Rs 74,427.41 crore outlay.

title: Inflation To 'Killers': Fake Claims In Trump's State Of The Union Address
content: US President Donald Trump delivered the longest address to Congress in modern history, speaking for one hour and 47 minutes while declaring that the "country is winning again".

title: "We Remember Israeli Lives Lost In 26/11": PM Modi's Top Quotes In Knesset
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday addressed the Knesset, Israel's parliament-- a rare honour that underscores the political warmth between the two democracies.

title: On Camera, Vendors Apply Rat Poison To Fruits In Mumbai
content: Two fruit sellers in Mumbai's Malad West area have been arrested after a video appeared to show them applying rat poison to fruits offered for sale.

title: PM Modi Israel visit LIVE: "I Was Born On Day India Recognised Israel": PM Modi To Knesset
content: Narendra Modi Israel Visit LIVE: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is travelling to Israel on a two-day high-profile visit on Wednesday, marking his second trip to Tel Aviv after the historic 2017 visit.

title: "That's Saffron": PM Modi As Netanyahu Notes Sartorial Match With Wife
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi arrived in Israel on Wednesday to a warm welcome from Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu and his wife, Sara Netanyahu, who were on the tarmac to receive him at the airport.

title: ECI proposes synergy with SECs to align electoral processes nationwide
content: Commission moots sharing of Electronic Voting Machines (EVM), electoral rolls and the ECINET digital platform.

title: Kochi City police screen footage of accidents to sensitise bus drivers
content: Videos of around 25 recent accidents, captured by CCTVs on the accident spots and those installed inside buses, from different parts of the State were screened

title: India ‘stands firmly’ with Israel, Modi tells Knesset
content: Prime Minister addresses the Israeli parliament as he begins visit to the West Asian country; India has an uncompromising policy of zero tolerance for terrorism with no double standard, he adds

title: 1.2 crore names may be deleted after SIR in Bengal, says Mamata
content: Will pray for the people who will find their names deleted from the final electoral rolls on February 28, says Trinamool Congress chairperson

title: Government to procure business jets for defence dignitaries and chiefs of armed forces
content: The decision to get a new fleet comes in the backdrop of the crash of a VSR Ventures-owned aircraft on January 28 that claimed the lives of Ajit Pawar, Maharashtra’s Deputy Chief Minister, and four others

title: PM Modi, Netanyahu discuss wide range of issues aimed at boosting bilateral ties
content: Narendra Modi, who is visiting Israel for the second time in nine years, was received by Benjamin Netanyahu and his wife, Sara, at the airport.

title: Police intensify probe into IIT Palakkad attack
content: Police suspect the assault was premeditated, noting that it took place in a poorly lit area of the campus that lacked surveillance camera coverage

title: ‘Karaparamba fish market, Puthiyangadi market buildings in need of urgent action’
content: An inspection by a team of engineers under the Kozhikode Corporation have so far completed the inspection of 12 age-old buildings within the city to check their fitness

title: U.S. slaps 126% duty on Indian solar imports
content: Tariffs were collectively imposed on India, Indonesia and Laos following  investigation that is ongoing

title: BJP warns of protest if recruitment process is not initiated in Karnataka
content: Taking exception to the State government not going ahead with recruitments to government posts as promised by the Congress before the Assembly elections, BJP State president B.Y. Vijayendra warned of a protest if the recruitment process was not initiated

title: PM Modi condoles death of veteran CPI leader Nallakannu
content: R. Nallakannu died at a government hospital in Chennai due to age-related ailments; he was about 101 years old.

title: Kerala’s Puthur Zoological Park to open for public on February 28
content: To help visitors explore the park, two non-AC electric buses of the Kerala State Road Transport Corporation have been readied. 330 animals have been shifted to 14 habitats

title: YSRCP regime destroyed State, says Naidu
content: Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy played a false drama that Veligonda works were finished and dedicated the project to the nation without completing them, claims Chief Minister

title: YC urges Kerala Governor not to approve State govt. nominee as PSC member
content: Youth Congress State president criticises government’s decision to raise upper age limit for PSC examinations to 40, calling it misleading and unfair to existing job aspirants

title: Forest dept. for rejecting human-wildlife mitigation grant
content: The department has succumbed to threats from certain organisations acting under the guise of farmer interests to reject the project, which was initiated by the MoEFCC to alleviate tensions in areas outside tiger reserves, say Wayanad Prakrithi Samrakshana Samithi

title: AKSSA demands immediate recruitment to vacant posts
content: Karnataka State Students Association president Kanthakumar urges State govt. to immediately announce a clear recruitment schedule

title: Kerala’s fisherfolk 'army' gets valuable rescue lessons from NIWS Goa
content: Kerala Fisheries department has been funding the training of selected fishermen from the State in sea rescue at the National Institute of Water Sports. Presently the 24th batch is undergoing training

title: CM is giving misleading information on employment, says Arvind Bellad
content: The Deputy Leader of Opposition has accused Siddaramaiah of making claims about providing jobs even before completing the process

title: CM inaugurates KTDC’s five-star resort at Muzhappilangad
content: The ₹238-crore integrated project aims to strengthen tourism infrastructure at Muzhappilangad beach, Dharmadam beach, and Dharmadam Island to attract more domestic and international visitors: CM

title: A.P. Assembly approves ₹41,590 crore grants for key departments
content: ₹863 crore given away for Governor, Council of Ministers, general administration and elections;  liabilities of ₹24,811 crore cleared in recent months

title: Inside the secret history of the black mamba
content: In late 2002, Nike began creating a global campaign featuring the black mamba -- and presented it to an NBA superstar. That star was not Kobe Bryant.

title: Hilary Knight: Women's team joke 'distasteful'
content: American gold medalist Hilary Knight called President Trump's comment about the women's team "distasteful" but said she chooses to celebrate the women's accomplishments.

title: Source: Bears allow LB Edmunds to seek trade
content: The Bears have granted linebacker Tremaine Edmunds permission to find a trade, a source confirmed to ESPN.

title: MVP odds tighten as SGA, Jokic near ineligibility
content: The odds to win the NBA's regular-season MVP have tightened, with the top two betting favorites -- Oklahoma City's Shai Gilgeous-Alexander and Denver's Nikola Jokic -- at risk of not qualifying for the award

title: Source: Broncos bring Colorado DC onto staff
content: The Broncos have hired Colorado DC Robert Livingston to be their defensive passing-game coordinator, a source told ESPN's Adam Schefter on Wednesday.

title: Harden questionable for Cavs with thumb fracture
content: The Cavaliers said guard James Harden is questionable for Wednesday night's game against the Bucks after suffering a non-displaced fracture in his right thumb Tuesday against the Knicks.

title: Prosecution rests in murder trial of ex-Cane Jones
content: Prosecutors rested their case against former Miami football player Rashaun Jones, who is accused of second-degree murder in the 2006 slaying of teammate Bryan Pata.

title: 'Promoter's Caution' out of NASCAR All-Star Race

title: Security forces recover IEDs, ammo in J&K’s Poonch
content:
JAMMU: A joint team of the Army and J&K Police on Wednesday recovered two Improvised Explosive Devices (IEDs) and assorted ammunition during an anti-terror exercise, codenamed Operation Ghani, in Poonch district, the Army stated. “Based on synergised intelligence inputs from own sources and J&K Police, a joint operation was launched by the troops of White Knight Corps and Special Operations Group of J&K Police in Gani forest area in Poonch,” the Army’s White Knight Corps stated in an X post. The searches led to the discovery of an arms cache concealed beneath a natural cave, the post said. “One big IED weighing 4.5kg, one small IED weighing 800g, two Chinese grenades, one 9mm pistol, two 9mm rounds, and 22 rounds of 7.62mm ammunition were recovered from the site,” an Army spokesperson said. The explosives and ammunition were destroyed in situ by a bomb disposal team.

End of Article
